title: Cannot authorize account with service provider
content:
Apparently, I was over-zealous in tidying up some things at my Fastmail account (e-mail service provider), and I removed authorization for Thunderbird to access it.

When I open Thunderbird, it asks for re-authorization. See my first screenshot. This page is blank, so I there's nothing I can do with it. It is blank even after I start my Macintosh in safe mode and then start Thunderbird in troubleshooting mode.

So I made a back-up copy of my profile, deleted my Fastmail account in Thunderbird, and tried to set up my account again. See my second screenshot. Thunderbird hangs while looking up the configuration, and there is no way apparent way to set up the account manually.

So I am stuck. How can I either re-authorize Thunderbird (obviously, the preferred outcome) or re-create my account in Thunderbird?
creator: mozilla98

title: Thunderbird says "unable to connect to imap.gmail.com" this happened2 days ago on my husbands laptop.
content: Any suggestions to help my husband regain access to gmail on his laptop would be very appreciated.
creator: alanduncan29

title: I can receive emails but can't delete them or forward them
content:
Matt replied to my question last night (thanks Matt), but when I went into my account to respond I couldn't find my original question thread to answer him. Maybe it is the time difference? (I'm in Australia)

My original question was:

I can read my emails but I can't delete or action my emails. They're just piling up in the inbox. Sometimes, I can delete just one and then, it stops deleting. Sometimes the New Message icon is brown and sometimes green. I have no idea why it changes colours.

I've been using Thunderbird for over 10 years and it's been great with no problems.

I'm a bit of a luddite and I'm finding the new changes are doing my head in. It doesn't work for me now.

I give a monthly donation to Thunderbird to support the work being done, but if I can't use my emails, I'll need to change from Mozilla to another email system.

I'd appreciate help, and, also appreciate some advice about how I find a response that is sent to me when I go back to Support to answer it. Thanks.
creator: dajoh

title: saved passwords
content: Tools>options>privacy & security>Passwords. Click 'show passwords' brings up the saved passwords in a separate box. Need ability to resize the box (and colums within the box). The columns are too small to see the entire contents of a column. Using TB 138.0

title: error after moving profile
content:
I have followed the instruction https://support.mozilla.org/de/kb/Benutzerprofile-Thunderbird#w_ein-profil-sichern to shift my profile from one harddrive to an other on my PC

The original profile is still on the old location %APPDATA%/Thunderbird I have updatet profiles.ini pointing to the new location At first glance it seemed to work Thunderbird was starting and when I cloesd it the date of files in the new location changed. But when I renamed the old profile in the old location Thunderbird does not start correctly and I only get 

   <menuitem id="folderPaneContext-getMessages" </pre> 
^ 
If I rename the old profiles again to the original names, it starts without any issues

title: Verwijderen mappen in de Inbox
content: Ik heb een map met een submap aangemaakt bij één van mijn accounts. Helaas was dat het verkeerde account en nu wil ik de (lege) mappen weer verwijderen. De optie via de rechter muisknop 'Map verwijderen' heeft geen enkel effect, zelfs niet na hertstart van mijn PC. Ook de optie in het menu 'Extra' heeft geen effect. Ik kan wel de naam veranderen, maar daar heb ik niet zo veel aan. Is dit een bug? Of ben ik verkeerd bezig? Graag hoor ik of er een oplossing beschikbaar is. Met vriendelijke groet, Ben Klinkenberg
creator: Ben2

title: Deleted messages from folders in deleted folder
content: Last week I moved some archived folders containing emails into the deleted folder and was horrified to discover all the emails within the folders had been deleted. Not once did any box pop up warning me this would happen if I continued. I had only just moved to Thunderbird as mu partner recommended it as I was getting fed up with BT and Outlook. Whenever I have deleted things in the past on over sites a message always pops up to warn or ask if you're sure you want to delete these messages as they will be permanently deleted. It seems strange that the folders are all there but all their contents have been deleted. The folders were dragged and dropped into the deleted box. I've tried various ways to try and find them and retrieve them but to no avail. Going forward it would be good to have a warning message to pop up to warn you. I guess these emails are now gone for good?
creator: j.woodgate49

title: Thunderbird MUST Be Caching TLS Certificates - Even Though It Doesn't ?!?!
content:
Hi All, :-)

I *know* (from various on-line posts over the years) that the accepted wisdom is that Thunderbird does *not* cache the TLS Certificates of the MDA(s) that it connects too - however, I can come to no other conclusion but this based on the information and investigations I have been able to gather over the last several days.  :-(

Our MDA (Dovecot, with Postfix and back-ended by MariaDB) hosts a number of Email Domains, each with its own Let's Encrypt Certificate. Our Thunderbird clients correctly "obtain" (via SNI) the correct(?) TLS Certificate from the MDA for each given Email Domain - or at least, "obtains" the *old* (ie out of date / expired) Certs.

And here's the thing: I've just spent the last 2 days trying to work out why the "old" certs are still being "obtained".

I've:

  • Gone over the Dovecot (and Postfix) configs - nothing, all correct
  • Searched the Storage of the actual servers - only Certificates found are the *new* (ie renewed) ones
  • Confirming that the Certificates located are correct by inspecting them (using Step-CLI) - yes, they are correct
  • Cross-confirming (vi OpenSSH) that the correct (new) certificates are being server by Dovecot - yes, they are
  • Checked that the "old" Certificates do not exist *anywhere* on the mail server, the local PCs (Rocky Linux with KDE), nor the database server (on the server or in the database itself)
  • Cleaned the Thunderbird Certificate Stores of all but CA Certificates

And yet, Thunderbird bitches and complains that the MDA's Certificates are "out of date", and when I ask Thunderbird to show me the offending Cert it presents the correct (for the relevant Email Domain) but "old" (ie expired) Certificate.

So, could someone please help me out in working out WTF is going on?  :-)

And, FTR, I'm quite ready to "eat humble pie" if it turns out I've gone and Fire-trucked something - so feel free to tell me so if that's the case  :-)

Thanks in advance

Dulux-Oz
creator: Dulux-Oz
